comments:
When adding a project from a repository that specifies a build JRE that does 
not exist in the host workspace, an error dialog is presented so the user can 
choose an alternate JRE. The dialog incorrectly displays the "java command" 
section of the tab which is irrelevant when choosing a JRE for the build path.

(1) Create a project that specifies a container with a non-default JRE
(2) Load the project into a workspace that does not have the same JRE defined
(3) Select a specific JRE, noting the "command section" appears.


As well, my workspace hung, with the following in the log (after choosing a JRE)
